subject: Home & DIY
title: Biophilic Design and Mental Health
description: A quick win: understand Biophilic Design and Mental Health.

hook.text: Hospital patients with a view of trees recover faster than those facing a brick wall. The difference is measurable.

buildup.text: Biophilic design brings nature into built spaces through plants, water features, natural light, and organic shapes.

discovery.text: Studies show indoor plants reduce stress hormones by 15% and improve concentration by up to 20% in office settings.

twist.text: Even nature imagery works. A wallpaper with a forest scene triggers similar calming effects to actual greenery.

climax.text: Our brains evolved in forests, not cubicles. Biophilic design essentially patches an evolutionary mismatch.

punchline.text: We left nature but our brains didn't.

quiz.question: What is biophilic design?
options: Incorporating natural elements into built environments
Using only organic materials in construction
Designing buildings that look like plants
